website_summaries.verdict: Innovative wearable mitt-like device with water-spraying rubber scrubbers in the palm gives dogs a deep cleaning.
pros: Slim, flexible, and can reduce pet's anxiety about getting washed
Leaves one hand free to massage, soap, or hold dog to keep it from squirming
Not a gimmick, works like a charm
cons: Some complained that the strap around the hand doesn't stay secure

customer_reviews.title: Click on, click off.  Works great and even the dog seems to like it!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to control water while washing your dog! (Check out the detailed video review that I put together). Very high quality unit, well deigned and constructed and the "bic pen" type on/off mechanism is really ingenious for controlling water flow while you wash your dog. Over the years, I've used a number of cheap versions of this in the past and always felt like I was struggling with the unit on my hand while trying to control the dog and the water- this elegantly solves that problem with the in palm flow switch. Also, I'm impressed that the set included everything needed to install the unit on a home shower including a y-valve and teflon tape.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy connection and doesn’t scare pets
customer_reviews.text: I love this aquapaw. It was so easy to connect and works great. I bought a bad knock off before this and returned it. I’m glad I paid the extra money for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: A good idea but it doesn't work for dogs with long hair.
customer_reviews.text: This product reduces water flow to the point it's useless. I have a very easy to bathe Border Collie. It took me 4 times longer to get my dog wet and lathered. When it came time to rinse the dog, I ended up removing the pet shower and attaching the regular shower head. I couldn't get the water down to his skin enough to get the soap out of his undercoat with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaegerares

customer_reviews.title: No more bathtime bruises!
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 month old puppy hated bath time! I bought this and the silicone suction thing for her to lick some peanut butter and bananas off of. It seriously made bath time a breeze! She was completely distracted and the speed that I could get her scrubbed and rinsed was amazing. Before it was a two person job, and I ended up with bruises, but with this set up it could be done by one person. Also, installation was very quick and easy!
customer_reviews.author: Britany

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is terrified of the bath! But with this hand held sprayer, it’s so easy to bathe her. Bath time is so much faster and more comfortable for her now. She doesn’t try to jump out of the tub because she’s terrified of the shower head, now she stays in and is very calm (I think because it probably feel like a massage to her and gives the sesnsation that I’m petting her).
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Wood

customer_reviews.title: PAWS before buying (sorry, couldn't resist)
customer_reviews.text: What an ingenious idea for a pet bathing tool! i think it's genius. Unfortunate, then, that it's so cheaply made it cracked in half before i had a chance to try it out even once. Until this is constructed of something worth its price, avoid it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Y splitter diverter is cheap and cracks easily
customer_reviews.text: I barely tightened the y splitter/diverter adapter that comes with this to my shower assembly and CRACK. The adapter now has a crack in it and is compromised. The adapter is probably the thinnest plastic I've ever seen on something that requires screwing onto and tightening to something. I just don't get why companies opt in to using cheap plastic over aluminum or brass. All I can say is be very careful when screwing this onto anything. I am surprised because of the great reviews on here. Returning and not reordering.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Plastic pieces are crap.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it looks like it should be awesome but the price that was supposed to allow both the shower and this bathing tool is made of plastic and broke during I stalation. we’ll either never know If this is a great bathing tool because I return it or I’ll have to spend more money to find a metal piece that won’t break so easily. Very frustrating. Update : we bought a new metal connector piece and I was so excited to use the actual hand shower for my dog! But the water squirts everywhere from the hose connecting to the shower. This was a total disappointment that just keeps becoming more disappointing! What a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stark

customer_reviews.title: Other than that I love this and so do my dogs
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is the strap that goes around your hand doesn't stay secure when using it. Other than that I love this and so do my dogs. It is calming for them so they sit still better and the spray of the shower or sink hose is unsettling for them. Glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So sad it broke:(
customer_reviews.text: I used this device three times to give my golden retriever a bath. First two times was amazing and I told all my friends and family about it. But the third time, the grey part disconnected from the blue hand part and I couldn’t get it to stay together and water kept getting everywhere.. I would contact the seller but there’s no option for that. Would buy another one but I’m afraid it might break again.
customer_reviews.author: Taelor Gibson

customer_reviews.title: About what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. I have a garden tub just collecting dust so I removed the spout, slapped on a shark bite male adapter and voila. The water pressure was lacking a little so I removed the two screws and took out the spring and shut off mechanism (2 little plastic pieces). I no longer have the ability to click off the water but the pressure is awesome now. Rinsing the soap out of my Great Pyrenees is much faster and easier now.
customer_reviews.author: Jason the Impetuous

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, time saving tool
customer_reviews.text: This took only 5 minutes to install in my shower - I have installed a showerhead before so I had basic knowledge of how to do this. I’m thrilled that they included plumbers tape and a washer. You don’t need anything but a wrench. Then I washed my three dogs in the amount of time I used to wash one. I didn’t hurt my back leaning over the tub and I didn’t get soaked like normal. As a pet owner of one 50lb dog and two 20lb dogs, this is seriously one of the smartest purchases I’ve made.
customer_reviews.author: WriteEnglish

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: After watching the Shark Tank pitch, I immediately ordered an Aquapaw. I was really excited to use it on my thick-fur GoldenDoodle. Boy, was I disappointed. The water connection adapter was cheap plastic, and the water pressure was abysmal, especially when more flow is needed for a thick coat. I'll keep it around and TRY to use it on an outside spigot with my other short-hair dog, but I'm not very confident that it won't end up in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product because you have your hand free and everything else in the store is only 6 feet long. I installed the product, making sure I used the tape around where you attach the nozzle and tightened it really well. I turned the water on and it spewed out of the back onto my wall and ceiling. GREAT! Now I have a dirty dog and a mess to clean up! Greatly dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C

customer_reviews.title: Almost Incredible...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! It really did help me bathe my dogs. I would give it a 4.55 out of 5 if I could. But I can't. The thing that is holding me back from a full 5 review is that I can't attach this to a utility sink faucet. My sink is large enough for my dogs to comfortably bathe in, but this does not screw onto a faucet. It's threaded for a shower or hose only. And there's no attachment included for my needs. Heck, I don't even know if it exists. But that's a corner of the market I'd assume they'd addressed already. This is an honest review from someone that actually likes the product.
customer_reviews.author: Slickflip

customer_reviews.title: Small dogs only
customer_reviews.text: If you dog is larger than 10 lbs do not waste you money. Small teacup size dogs I think it may work fine Also connected to a tub in the basement with the garden hose size connector(where I hook up my hoses) and it would not seal.Water sprayed all over.I could not get it to seal I changed the rubber washer and even added a second No deal
customer_reviews.author: Snakeman

customer_reviews.title: Shower adapter broke the first time I tried to install it...
customer_reviews.text: Shower adapter broke the first time I tried to install it... cheap peace of plastic. I used just my hand strength... and I'm a 61 year old woman who has trouble opening tight jar lids. What a piece of crap. I wondered if it would even support my rather heavy shower head, which I didn't even get to test out. The rest of it looks to be better made, but I'm really unhappy since now I have to unhook my shower head every time I want to wash the dog.
customer_reviews.author: nishabone

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The unit started separating at the base, where the blue meets the grey, which caused the water to shoot out at my wrist. The installation process was not clear either. The blue/black buttons located at the shower needs to to have the blue button depressed your bathroom will need to be wiped dried, as the water squirts out! I washed 6 dogs for the first time with AQUAPAW and as the canines may have enjoyed having their bodies being massaged, I was constantly pushing the unit back on the hose to finish rinsing them. Frankly, it was a pain in the a$$ and I'll be looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: BEST dog shower
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT product. Best product I’ve found for washing our black labs. It has, what I would consider, a “soaker“ type of spray. Great for washing, but does not elicit anxiety from our dogs - even when washing their faces. The nibs on the handpiece work great for removing loose/shedding fur. The hand piece has an easy-to-use on/off clicker. This makes it very convenient for rinsing or washing. Really, I can’t say enough positive things about this product. If I could give it 10 stars – I would have. Don’t hesitate to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Makes shower time for the dog faster and more efficient I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Makes it easier to get in the the layers of far and scrub out the dirt. Makes a shower time for the dog faster and more efficient I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: ZEUSXZ

customer_reviews.title: Fresh smelling dog= Happy owner.
customer_reviews.text: Finally something that allows me to wash my Labrador without wasting water, get lather exactly where I need, no water into her ears and eyes, and a complete rinse. Used many times. The hand piece does sometimes slip off the hose but it’s easily pushed back on and now I just reach around while washing and pushing it down into place. Maybe a future redesign will improve the male/female attachment on that weak point. There is also a lot of attachments for different water connections. I’ve been using only the one for outdoor hose.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila K.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: So pleasantly surprised by this product! Before we would have to put our dog in the tub and fill up buckets to dump over and over, making it a two man job. This was super easy to attach to the shower head and makes it so easy to bathe her without wasting a ton of water! The pressure isn’t extreme but good enough to get the job done, and the head size is large enough to let a good amount of water out. Only con is that it smelled super bad and strong after taking it out of the packaging (like enough to smell up the whole shower), but it went away after a week or so.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Best pet-washer attachment I've found
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different pet-washer attachments for the shower. This one is the best one I've found. Works well and has decent water pressure. We get some dripping from where it connects to the showerhead, but it is really nice that it has a push-button to switch back and forth between showerhead and the aquapet. Similar hoses I have used require you to disconnect the hose which is inconvenient and makes it hard to keep the bathroom neat.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Smelled of Weed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this because my girl is terrified of baths. HOWEVER when I ooened the package (which yes was tonight because it was in another box after we moved) it smelled like weed so bad we had to throw it out. Even the box that I left in my sink made my bathroom smell so bad that I had to light several candles to mask the smell. Now I have a headache and my bathroom and outside trash can smell like weed. Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Mommy C

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to use
customer_reviews.text: if only this worked as advertised, easy enough to hook up to shower valve but the amount of presser needed to make water flow from the handheld part is ridiculous it is impossible to do with one hand which is the whole point for this item so that you can keep your animal from getting too nervous about a bath. Poorly designed does not work, I will be returning. Boooo !
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Rodwell

customer_reviews.title: Dog now likes baths a little more than b4
customer_reviews.text: Great concept with a few bugs. The connection of the hose at the scrubber squirts when you turn on or off so there is a little bit of a learning curve when you first get. One thing I’d improve is the Shower head connection - it’s poorly manufactured plastic and it leaks because it will only tighten so much. This isn’t a deal breaker - I just caulked the fittings which in the long run stops the leaks but makes harder to remove. It’s a great tool I’d buy again
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Handy way to wash the dog, and faster too.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Well built, works very well. I have a big laundry sink so washing the dog wasn't too difficult. I cobbled together a spray head and a hose. But this is better, for several reasons. First, the on-off click valve is sweet. Wet the dog, click to turn water off. Soap the dog. Click on to rinse the dog. Click off. Second: No need to adjust the temperature each time you turn the water on and off. Third: The water is right there, on my hand, along with rubber bristles to work through the dog fur. Faster, better washing and rinsing. Nicely made product.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Rubenzahl

customer_reviews.title: Great for walk in showers and bathing pets
customer_reviews.text: The hose works really well and is the perfect length for a standard shower allowing you to reach both ends of the shower in case the dog paces around. The switch in the palm is so great as are the scrubbing brissels. The water diverter is made of plastic and despite using all the Teflon tape it still leaked. Upon closer inspection the plastic mold had a defect in the treads. So I ordered a different metal diverter and it worked much better, no leaks. For this reason I gave it 4 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: NO instructions, water doesn't flow out of the head at all.
customer_reviews.text: I unscrewed my current shower head, attached the multi arm piece with a little plumbing tape (included) and re-attached the shower head. inserted the quick connect hose and turned the water on, my shower head worked fine, the dog washing hose doesn't work at all, not a drop, the instructions seem basic enough but there is no way to contact the company. they clearly are a reseller and this shoddily made in China product is being sold as multiple names by multiple brands.
customer_reviews.author: DEREK

customer_reviews.title: This bathing tool is genus!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this yesterday and was so excited to use it. I have 5 dogs under 20 lbs so I chose the one with the longest hair (a terrier mix that hates baths). I hooked it to the utility sink in seconds and no leaks. This thing is genius! It wets and rinses very fast without water spraying everywhere. It cleans great, massages, and takes out the loose hair. Just a touch of a finger to stop water flow to lather my dog. It appears to be well made but if it breaks in a year I will buy another one! Best $ I ever spent on my dogs. It cuts bath time in half with no mess.
customer_reviews.author: susan wrenn

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. My dog doesn't run from it. They appreciate the massage effect. I appreciate the bath goes faster. My only complaint would be no clear instructions on how to hook it up comes with the package. I finally figured it out before the email from Aquapaw sent tips on how to fit the connector properly. So use the plumber tape on main faucet opening and push the connector in all the way while holding the side back and then release the side and you will be in business. Your dog or pet will like their bath better with this devise.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after literally 3 pushes of the button...
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing I can say about this is that it was very easy to install. Otherwise it seems like complete crud. I used the on/off button in the palm literally only 3 times and now it's broken, stuck in the off position. Needless to say, I'll be returning this. Hopefully I'll be able to change the review if the next one doesn't break so unbelievably easily. I love the concept of the design, but it's useless if the product doesn't actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Kalinoski

customer_reviews.title: Works great, smells awful
customer_reviews.text: Works great for getting under bellies and ensuring all soap is rinsed out. The tubing is pretty narrow though so it works best if you don’t turn the water all the way on, otherwise it sprays out where it’s attached. Only really for 4 stars is the plastic smells AWFUL!!! Almost like burnt plastic. Luckily our dog washing “station” is an old shower in our basement, I wouldn’t want to smell this in my own bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for anti-bath pups!
customer_reviews.text: Our pup hated bath time. We had to pick him up and put him into the tub, and he weighs 70 pounds, so that was absolute torture. But, with aquapaw, bath time is his jam. He wags his tail while he’s getting washed, he jumps into the bath tub on his own, and he even gets into the bath tub now when it’s not bath time 😂 It’s so much quicker to bathe him, too, without refilling a bucket 500 times. Bath time is so much easier, so it happens so much more frequently and we love not having a stinky pup anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin Borrmann

customer_reviews.title: Great for long-haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have 5 dogs, 3 American Eskimos and 2 short-haired mixes (3 fosters who never left), making bath time a marathon. Eskies have long hair and heavy coats, so it took forever to get the hair wet. This tool works perfectly and cuts bath time down substantially - the scrubber gets the water through the mass of hair and down to the skin very quickly - it also worked well for the short-haired mixes. Shorter bath time, with less fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly D.

customer_reviews.title: Good for short and long hair and make’s bathing easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing a while ago but we were moving at the time so I’ve just now installed it. Super easy to install! But the reason I really love it is that it makes washing my dogs super easy. I have a Chihuahua mix and a German shepherd mix and it made bathing them faster and easier. Neither one of them exactly fight baths but they more slowly try to worm their way out of the bathtub. So the quicker the bath the better. It’s gentle enough for the short haired Chihuahua but does a good job of rinsing the longer haired German shepherd mix. Five stars easy.
customer_reviews.author: s.marie

customer_reviews.title: I can’t say enough good things about it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on a comment from a rescue group, and I’m so happy I did. I have a Lab/Shepherd mix who is not to keen about baths. This tool is great, she’s very relaxed, no more shaking, it feels like I’m petting her as I’m getting her soaked. She has a double coat and this makes it easy and fast to get her perfectly wet. No more splashes all over, no water waste, but most importantly, my dog does not feel like she’s being tortured when bathe. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea D.

customer_reviews.title: This is the original
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Makes bathing quick and easy. The best part is that we found a way to give our lab mix a WARM bath outdoors: HINT - if you have a laundry sink or slpp sink near a door, you can buy an aerator to garden hose adapter for about $6 at Lowe's or Home Depot, then run a hose from the sink to your Aquapaw in your outdoor bathing area and use the warm water from the sink for a nice warm bath! On another note: This is the original. Please don't buy a knockoff from patent thieves. This works great. The others - not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Fortunate Son

customer_reviews.title: It is so much easier to wash our small dogs in the shower instead of outside in a tub.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. It is so much easier to wash our small dogs in the shower instead of outdoors in a tub. The dogs definitely prefer the water coming from the palm of my hand instead of a hose, plus the water from the shower is warm, so they don't shake near as much. The component supplied work well. Put your bathing suit on and go for it, just make sure you have plenty of towels handy so when the dogs shake it does not go all over your bathroom walls!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Makes giving a bath a lot easier.
customer_reviews.text: This made giving a bath to four pugs a lot easier and lesser water consumption. I used it outside with the garden hose, it has all the connectors I need for garden hose and for my bathroom shower. My pugs love it so much that they keep still during the bath like I'm giving them a belly rub. I can rinse the soap a lot easier from their chest and belly with just one hand than a hand held shower. Seems a good quality material. I'm always very gentle of handling things so time will tell how good the quality of this product is. So far I'm satisfied using this product.
customer_reviews.author: 2/3rd

customer_reviews.title: Works for us!
customer_reviews.text: I have a little Boston Terrier shelter pup who is afraid of just about everything (just adopted him a month ago). When I first turned this on, it was spraying on the bottom of the tub, and he was terrified of the noise. Once I used the click on/off button with the hand tool on him, it eliminated the sound and he sat still! He doesn’t love bathes, but at least he tolerates it now. I will say that taking off my own shower head to put this attachment on was a bit of the pain, but I followed the instructions and made sure things were tight, and I haven’t had a leak so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how they expect a cheap plastic attachment not to break under water pressure. 2nd replacement and same result. Plastic is equivalent to a toy car. Shame it's a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: NamboRambo

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I’ve ever made
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have ever made. I have three dogs. Two curly doodle mixes and one terrier/schnauzer that’s terrified of a hose. The first time I used this I did it outside with the garden house. It was nice to not have to squeeze the trigger on the hose nosel bc it scares two of my three. The scrubbers are nice on the curly doodle hair too. The part that REALLY sealed the deal for me was that it can attach to an indoor shower head. It’s super easy to instal, and now winter baths are a BREEZE. No more 40 min cup of water baths. I can’t say enough good things about this product!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this product -- and was sure that I was setting myself up for disappointment! But I was wrong! The install was SO EASY! And I'm terrible at anything 'handy' related. Protip (that probably everyone else knows). They send Teflon tape to grease/seal the faucets. It only needs to be wrapped 2-3x. I used it all! Lol, that wasn't necessary! The hose goes on and off the thing-y really easily. And the water turns off and on easily. My dogs hate baths -- but this has made it easy and less traumatic.
customer_reviews.author: Book Nerd MN

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: As I was installing it was fine, just needed to tighter my shower head portion a little more. But once I installed the aquapaw adapter the stupid threadings cracked so easily and deemed it unusable. Very very weak product, going to return and try again. If it is better I will change my review but for now horrible product. Saw it on shark tank and was impressed, I hope they redeem themselves with this next one I get. Next one I got was just as bad, don’t get this cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Baez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for dogs who hate baths
customer_reviews.text: My dog HATES getting clean. This thing is a lifesaver. As long as I kept the “paw” close to her (as opposed to spraying her with it even from just a few inches away), she was totally calm and didn’t freak out at all. I gave “sturdiness” 5 stars, but really don’t know yet as I just got it. I also connected it to my hose outside, so I can’t comment on how it works attaching to a shower head. But for anxious dogs who are uncomfortable being bathed, the aquapaw is a total miracle.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Omg this thing is amazing. I normally have to turn off the water when bathing the fur baby and by then she’s already ran off. This gadget allows me to turn water off and lather her up with soap and then turn it on. Easy installation and attached to shower head or outdoor faucet. This gadget will allow me to give our fur baby more baths now that I can do it indoors. Our fur baby loves it too. Drinks water from it. Highly recommend. Decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Definitely going to recommend
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome little tool. Personally I think it’s better for smaller dogs just because the water pressure isn’t as hard and it would or should be to get the job of bathing a bigger dog done in a faster amount of time. I still really like it though.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Corbo

customer_reviews.title: Water sprayed EVERYWHERE! Cheap plastic quick connect is its undoing.
customer_reviews.text: Removed quickly after getting soaked by it. The valve lessened water pressure to main shower, which was tolerable. But when you click it over to the Aquapaw side, water was going everywhere except to the paw itself. Most of it was coming out of the quick connect piece as I layered the provided teflon tape up to prevent it from leaking there. Seems like a great idea, but the plastic bits just killed it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S.

customer_reviews.title: I am obsessed with this! I have a 71lb ...
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with this! I have a 71lb black lab/boxer mix and this product means I don't have to put on a bathing suit and get in the shower with him in order to get him clean. With the AquaPaw, its 10-15 minutes and done. No more back aches from being bent over, no more water everywhere! I tell every dog owner I know about this product. I got one for myself and then another as a gift for my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves this, he was not a fan of baths but kid you not he jumps in the tub now. I start off with no water, use this to completely get him wet rubbing out the loose hair as well, squeeze my hand closed to stop it, basically turn it off, add shampoo to him and use this hand like brush to scrub him down, works great. Then click my hand down into my palm and water starts back rinsing him. So easy to install and the hose that attaches is plenty long enough.
customer_reviews.author: vee

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFIC FOR SHORT HAIR BREEDS
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY reason this is getting just 4 stars is that I am concerned about the durability of the unit. It is inexpensively made (not sure what should be done differently), so unsure of the longevity. They thought of everything, from the easy clip-on to the diverter. The on/off button is sometimes difficult to access, but certainly adds to its desirability. I have a large breed short hair dog and the amount of water that comes thru the "mitt" isn't significant, so works well for me. Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl A. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Diverter cracked
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to use this on my dogs. I attached it to the shower pipe as instructed. Very easy to use. I noticed it was leaking at the pipe/diverter connection. I hand tightened it slightly and hear a pop. The diverter cracked and was now leaking thru the crack. I loved the ease of bathing the dog, I just wish the diverter was made of some kind of metal. Now I will have to look for one.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C Drake

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!
customer_reviews.text: This has made bath time for my 50lb lab mix so much easier! Yeah, I could hose her off in the driveway, but neither of us likes that very much. Plus it really sucks when it's even a little cool outside. This way she gets a nice warm bath, I don't get soaking wet in the process, it's MUCH easier to actually rinse all the soap off of her, AND my back doesn't hurt when it's all over. 10/10 would buy again and I've recommended it to every single friend/family member that has a dog.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Makes bathtime so much EASIER
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is amazing! How and why have I not discovered this product before?!?! Having a huge Bullmastiff with thick short hair, bathing him is quite difficult. I never seemed to get him as clean as a groomer would. However with this new gadget...my dog is clean and happy. What is amazing about this product is that it attaches to your hand, easy to install, easy to use and also massages and gets down deep in his short thick hair. I also love the fact, that it seems to lift all of the loose hair out as well. If you are thinking about getting this...DO IT! You will LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Steeler girl

customer_reviews.title: Some parts are made of cheap plastic and may break.
customer_reviews.text: The hand held shower piece works great! But the attachment they provide to attach to the shower head is made of cheap plastic and broke without me applying hardly any pressure. I ended up buying a “Delta Shower Arm Diverter for Hand Shower, Chrome” made of metal to replace it. Now the product works great, just wish I didn’t have to buy an extra part.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Good For Humans too!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the Aquapaw Pet Bathing Tool on our sweet doggie for several months. Fortunately, she enjoys taking a bath. This device allows us to have more control over water direction especially when washing her face. This applies to humans as well. My husband recently had foot surgery. Per doctor's instructions he was not to submerge the foot in water. While sitting on a shower stool and using a protective foot covering the Aquapaw Pet Bathing Tool allows him to direct water exactly were it is needed and not were it is wanted. We are very happy with this pruchase
customer_reviews.author: K & P

customer_reviews.title: I can finally bathe my dog!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is so afraid of the sound of running water in the shower. Have not been able to bathe him properly until now! It installs easily and comes with the plumbers tape needed for installation. So handy to have the on/off button on my palm so I can quickly stop the flow of water if my dog starts to get scared and run. I can also hold it next to his skin to reduce the sound of water running into the tub which is what he objects to.
customer_reviews.author: landlord

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient for dog bath
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I give this product 4 stars overall is that it greatly reduced the water pressure on the outdoor hose. It took me a minute to figure out how to get it strapped onto my hand, but it was super nice to be able to turn the water on and off without having to do a reach-around to find the hose I had dropped on the ground! My hand is on the smaller side, so the middle button was a bit of a stretch to reach with my fingers, but not a deal breaker! Over all, I'm very glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy G

customer_reviews.title: Both my dog and I give it a thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: My Coton de Tulear has a thick fine coat of cottony fur. Underneath all that fluff he's just a little scrawny pup. Before I got this awesome tool I just poured water on him and it never reached the depth of his fur so basically I was just washing the surface and pushing the dirt down closer to his skin. Now I can reach all those layers with a gentle "water petting". He's much more tolerant and the end result (after the wet scrawny pup part) is 3x the fluff and 3x the cuteness. I'm really happy I bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: ScoutOut

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: My dogs do NOT like the loud running water sounds during a bath. This really helped keep them calm. It was easy to click on and off, and it didn’t startle them because I was able to hold it close to them. The hose is plenty long to reach the awkward angles of a dog who is at the far corner trying not to participate. :) I would recommend this to any animal owner who had difficulties with anxiety in the tub. You can switch back and forth easily from the regular shower head to the hand washer.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Purtell

customer_reviews.title: Very aggravating!
customer_reviews.text: I used this outside and connected it using the spicket piece it came with. It leaked water (yes it was hooked up properly) and it was extremely difficult to switch the water on and off on the hand piece. The hand piece itself is hard to keep on your hand once you start using soap. The only plus side to using this is that it was easy to get the soap off my dog. Overall i was more aggravated using it and should have just purchased an entire glove to scrub my dogs down with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this item. I read the reviews and am always concerned about negative ones but as far as this is concerned I can’t think of anything negative. It has made giving my dog a bath so much faster and easier and less messy. It’s the most practical purchase I have ever made. It was easy to install. I’m terrible at that stuff but I did it without too much difficulty. The criticism that it is made of cheap plastic is possibly true. It may not last forever but for the price I don’t think it has to.
customer_reviews.author: Nature lover

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Plastic Diverter
customer_reviews.text: This is a good concept but completely worthless product. The most critical piece; the diverter and value; is made of cheap plastic. During install I gently hand tightened and the entire diverter housing cracked. Do not buy this product unless they replace the plastic diverter with a metal diverter:
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Defective oring mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Worked only 2 times. Oring inside mechanism got loose with normal water pressure. Un assembled mechanism to put back oring in place again and failed with water pressure. Terrible design mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Water saver.
customer_reviews.text: Bath time is so much easier now. The water stream provides plenty of water to thoroughly wet and rinse the dog, and turning it on and off is as easy as making a fist. I like not having to fill the tub with water, and the dog definitely prefers this method of bathing. He used to hide (or at least try to) every time he heard the bath water running. Product was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: NV

customer_reviews.title: Good idea. Failed execution.
customer_reviews.text: Not enough support or instructions. The package included some high level instructions (literally like 3 steps) and nothing at all for trouble shooting about water pressure or anything - which was an issue for me. Simple instructions but almost too simple. Made 2 mistakes (outside of the water pressure issue) and ended up drenching myself and my bathroom in water. Also, the tape for the pipe is cheap and awkward inside the plastic ring.
customer_reviews.author: Rosegirl

customer_reviews.title: Worst smell in the world
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what is the cause but immediately out of the package the washer smelled as if it were off gassing some sort of awful chemical. Couldn't stand to be in the same room with it let alone hook it up and use. If cancer had a smell it would smell like this.
customer_reviews.author: tyler balazic

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: We use a large stall shower to bathe our dogs. We were able to connect this as we have a handheld sprayer in addition to the shower head. However, it didn’t seem to do as much as our handheld head. It seemed to not get soap off as quickly, and my dogs didn’t seem to “enjoy” the brushing effect. They would rather just be out faster. We won’t be using it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Wrong parts, return window closed
customer_reviews.text: Well we finally got around to installing it... the return window closed months ago.... the quick connect is MUCH too large for the piece that installs in the shower. Great.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Winchell

customer_reviews.title: Golden Retriever tested, Golden Retriever approved.
customer_reviews.text: Just gave my very skittish and skeptical golden retriever a bath with the Aquapaw and he LOVED it. He typically tries to run away from the hose or even the hand held shower attachment. He stood there while I watered him down and smiled at me! He was a good boy for his bath but this product was 100% the reason!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap connectors, but does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: The actual device works as it should but as you might expect, the connector to the shower head was made from plastic and does leak a bit, which is not much of an issue. Just be careful when you tighten it to not over tighten as it could easily crack. My wife got this after seeing it on Shark Tank. I don't see the need for this device personally, when your fingers and a big plastic cup from a football concession stand works just as well...I guess they both cost about the same, but the cup came with an ice cold beverage in it.
customer_reviews.author: Fat58hwy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waist your money
customer_reviews.text: While the product worked it was fantastic! Loved it BUT the adapter if plastic and it leaked. Used it twice then it finally broke. Very disappointed because it was a fantastic idea!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy F.

customer_reviews.title: For Small-Medium Dogs Without Thick Hair Only
customer_reviews.text: The idea is good and it seems to work relatively well. HOWEVER, do not buy this if you have a large or giant breed dog with thick hair. There is not enough stream coming out and not enough water force delivered, much less than a typical garden hose nozzle, for a large thick-haired dog. Probably would work very well with small to medium dogs (e.g., Chihuahua, Basset Hound, etc.) or maybe a large dog with very short hair (e.g., Weimaraner), but definitely not (as we tried) with a 135lb. Akita. It would have taken FOREVER with this device. Had to end up throwing it away. Again, probably a great tool for the right application/dog.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: The dog likes it, I don't.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised for the on/off functions. However if your hand is larger than a 7th grade girl's hand and you're an adult male this will not strap to your hand without creating a tourniquet that will disfigure you from the knuckles to the fingertips.
customer_reviews.author: Lance D. Classen

customer_reviews.title: No matter how much tape I put, it will still leak
customer_reviews.text: I've put many layers of tape, tried to remove all the tape and reapply. Nothing worked. Feels like the metal screw is not well structured at the top of the adapter. Too bad. Was really looking forward to this product.
customer_reviews.author: L3V

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I guess I got this one mixed up with another version that could connect over the tub spout. This only connects to a threaded sink or hose spicket, or pertinently attaching at your shower head. And for any of these installation options the 8 foot hose is just not long enough. I I wanted to bathe my dog outside using very cold water, I would just use a garden hose! Also the spicket adapter didn’t make a good connection (after repeated attempts) and water sprayed everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Water flow is great
customer_reviews.text: I have used this about 5 times since my purchase and so far so good! The flow of the water is fantastic and the dog loves the massage while he is getting bathed. So far I have only used in on my outdoor hose so can not comment on the indoor attachment. The on/off option is great for water saving as well! I don't have to keep running back and forth to turn on and off.
customer_reviews.author: MamaHrey

customer_reviews.title: Took a minute to get use to it
customer_reviews.text: I think that this could be a bit bigger in length so that you can brush a bit more but once I did get used to it in my hand. I was good to go. This little gadget did wash my dogs with ease and even brushed them a little bit. It took me a minute to get used to the on and off button but I love that. My dogs loved it too. They usually hate baths and hoses but this was just the amount of water pressure that they stuck around instead of running. :-) I will be using this again and again.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINA

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this tool!  Saves a TON of grooming money...!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this tool! It makes cleaning our lab SO much easier!!! He used to get impatient and try to escape the shower (covered in soap) when I had to stop to turn water on and off and grab the shower head. This makes life SO much easier!! You can keep the tool on your hand while washing and rinsing, and the water flow starts and stops with a simple click of your fingers. Bathing him couldn't be easier now. We haven't taken him to the groomers since we've had it... WELL worth every penny. LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Quiet less stress on my dog
customer_reviews.text: I watched the video On Amazon to get this installed correctly. It's really no big deal. I wish the attachment piece to my shower was not plastic. That's my only complaint, a metal one would certainly hold up better. As far as convenience this works great! I have a 5 month old sheepadoodle. Its quiet, less stressful and easier to control than dumping water on her. She is MUCH LESS STRESSED
customer_reviews.author: mickyj

customer_reviews.title: this is not easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This looked so easy on shark tank but what it doesn't show you is that you need a wrench and another tool to take apart the shower faucet to install the diverter. I've never been able to get mine to work and i've sent a request for refund and have never gotten a reply. The package also has an odd smell, like skunk. What looked like a brilliant idea has turned out to be a $25 waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far for our husky mix who is terrified of water, tubs and garden hoses! I was able to bathe her myself (instead of two of us) in less than half the time! She tolerated it so much better, and I was able to keep the spray out of her face. Highly recommended! Not sure how long it will last due to the materials.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Turpin

customer_reviews.title: Ok for small animals with less hair
customer_reviews.text: Really poor water pressure. it's Probably good for a small animal but my 125#Lab / GS fur is very thick so using this is NOT efficient. Instead the removable shower wand does a stellar job .
customer_reviews.author: HA Shevak

customer_reviews.title: They have quick shipping
customer_reviews.text: Aquapaw Pet Bathing Tool was very easy to use. Our Yellow Lab really enjoyed the Scrubber attachement. It was a little hard to get the button for the water to stay on, but my husband turned it on for me with no problem. Great product. I will recommend to my family and friends. By the way I used the one for outside since he is a very large Lab.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bickers

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This has saved me and my dog a lot of anxiety when it's bath time. I no longer have to dump cups of water over her to get the soap off and she is not standing in her dirty water. She also likes the contact of me rubbing her with the party that is on my hand. It does leak a tad bit around the connector but that is not too bothersome.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Blakeney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for stand up showers
customer_reviews.text: I have a large dog and a stand up shower only. This product is perfect to clean the mud and dirt off of him after a day at doggie daycare. The water pressure that comes out of the hand device so nice that in just a few swipes the shampoo is rinsed away. We will be ordering again for sure and need to get one for our cabin too.
customer_reviews.author: Aimakins

customer_reviews.title: A solution to bathing my 130 lb Great Dane!!
customer_reviews.text: Aquapaw rocks! Up until now I had taken my dog to the groomers and at times, the groomer would be a bit taken aback by his size. Rather than worrying about either parties being anxious, I purchased the Aquapaw. Installation was easy and I like that it unhooks simply when you are done using it. My dog seemed to enjoy the massage and water at the same time! Definitely recommend this product and I've already told my friends/family about it! Makes for giving baths more frequently with low stress!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Carter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best thing I’ve bought on Amazon. I gave my small dog a bath with it last night and instead of her trying to run away and me getting more back pain from bending over, I came out with no pain! She stayed still and was calm the entire time too! I can’t wait to use this on client’s dogs!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tsukiko Brown

customer_reviews.title: Asbolute 100% garbage
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these devices and due to their horrendously shoddy construction, was unable to get either of them to work without leaking. The gaskets they send are entirely too small for the diameter of the seat in the diverter valve and the diverter valve is the cheapest piece of plastic garbage made to no particular tolerance at all. Absolutely a garbage product do not waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: M. B. K.

customer_reviews.title: Makes bath time easier
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is terrified of bath time. With this attachment, we can easily and quickly wet her down, soap her up and clean it off without having to worry about getting in those hard to reach spots. It also lessens the amount of water that gets spilled around the tub since we can control it with our hand - including clicking it on and off with the same hand. It's a great tool to have for any doggy bath time.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna S.

customer_reviews.title: excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates baths. Getting him wet with a bucket is a chore that prolongs his discomfort. Soaking his fur with the aquapaw is a breeze. The rubber nubs just pull the dead hair off. The diverter, with a little teflon tape (provided) goes on by hand and works nicely. the quick connect does not leak and the sprayer goes in a drawer when not in use. It has been used twice on the dog and several times to spray off my sandals. It seems like it has decent durability.
customer_reviews.author: John k.

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Makes bath time easy
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! It made bathing my dogs so much easier. I have a husky and she is so hard to bathe because of all the hair. This made it super easy to get her wet and then it was so much easier washing the soap out. I just wish the splitter was metal instead of plastic, but other than that it is great!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Would Not Flow
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. Could not get water to flow more than a trickle at any time. I have good city water pressure, so I do not know the issue. I ended up converting my garden tub spout to a garden hose adapter and using that.
customer_reviews.author: Hrmn315

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install and it Works!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install, only took like 5 min and it works!!!! With this Quarantine happening we haven't been able to take our 100lb German Shepherd to get a bath and hee hates water and the tub. This made it so much easier!!! Very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap adapter
customer_reviews.text: The idea for this is great. Too bad the parts are cheap. The cheap, plastic adapter broke in half during installation while being hand tightened by a 100 lb. woman. Bought a new one from the hardware store which made this usable. I should have just returned it for a refund. Unfortunately, I can not recommend this product because of have to buy parts to replace the parts that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Dibble

customer_reviews.title: Bath Time Just Got Easier!
customer_reviews.text: This made washing my Lab x10 easier in a bathtub. The (on/off) feature is truly awesome and effective for saving water use. The installation was a bit tedious but with the right tools and with the included shower head attachments and plumbers tape, it was fairly quick. I was tremendously surprised by how effective this product was, with washing my pet it made getting the paws and underbelly incredibly easy. Lastly, clean up was honestly a breeze. The ingenious pull release spring helps to remove the sprayer quickly and a quick shake and tilt, the water can just fall right out. I would HIGHLY recommend this tool if you frequently bathe your pets at home!
customer_reviews.author: Diego M.

customer_reviews.title: So much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I love how convenient it is to hook the aquapaw up and still have a functioning showerhead in place. Before aquapaw, it was so difficult to keep my wiggly dogs in place with one hand and maneuver either a cup of water or the showerhead (always on and spraying water everywhere). Aquapaw makes the bathing process so much easier and works the water through my dog's multi-layered coat too! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Cheather LLC

customer_reviews.title: This product would not fit the connection in my laundry room
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed. This product did not fit the connection in my laundry room. I was going to use it for the first time & couldn't get it to fit. I missed the return time on it.
customer_reviews.author: DebraV

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase based on the mixed reviews. Glad I took the chance. It was so easy to install to my existing shower head and has made bathing my dogs so much simpler. I have two Poms and one Chow to bathe. Being able to turn the water on or off with a click of the finger is a God-send. The massaging mitt enables me to get to the skin thru all the fur and I know I'm getting all the shampoo rinsed out now. Less frightening to my pack than my traditional shower wand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer
